page.title: 07BOMBS ON THE RASKELF ROAD
page.content: { Mr and Mrs Peacock live in a house {called 'The Birches' that is {bomb-proof.The house is bomb-proof {because their land was used as a bomb {dump in the Second World War. { The house is forty-six years old. {The Peacocks have their own water {supply,a facility necessary because of {the importance of their property to {the war effort. { They have six acres of land upon {which they grow their own vegetables. {Some of this land is rented from the {Church Commissioners who are important {landlords in this Domesday block.As {with Mr Clark's land (see page two) {the ground is extremely fertile. { Mrs Peacock uses the village Chapel {and says,"Aye,it's a pity it will {close down soon."
